alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman; Randolph; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 11:03AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Clay, Randolph, Quitman and northwestern Terrell Counties through NOON EDT... At 1102 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Cuthbert to 6 miles northeast of Richards Crossroads. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cuthbert, Georgetown, Shellman, Parrott, Wire Bridge, Bonapartes Retreat, Watson Crossroads, Crossroads, Ricks Place, Chambliss, Hatcher, Morris, Benevolence, Springvale, Cotton Hill, Wades, Days Crossroads, Springvale Station, Pachitla and Peterson Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
